title: Signal to Noise in Low-Dose Ptychography: The Effect of Imaging Parameters and Partial Coherence
content: Ptychography makes use of the so-called 4D-scanning transmission electron microscope (4D-STEM) data set where diffraction patterns are recorded as a function of a scanned illuminating electron probe and can be used to form an image dependent on the phase shift of the transmitted electron wave. As such, the technique is capable of forming images of light elements and makes efficient use of the transmitted electrons, allowing relatively low doses for beam-sensitive materials. These attributes have been used for atomic-resolution imaging of carbon nanostructures [1], Li-ion battery materials [2] and polymer crystallinity [3].
